content.description: Starts on right corner of the small face that Slitty Titty Traverse ends on. Crouch start on stacked pockets. Climb up using good slopey holds to the top. The downclimb is to the right - using the big tree and the wall next to it.
content.protection: Pads. A rocky landing. Better to have multiple pads to flatten the landing out.
content.location: On the Slitty Titty Boulder, the left (toward the road) arete just visible from the parking lot. From the parking lot, Walking he Dog starts on the arete just past the base of the downclimb tree.

content.description: Classic, techy traverse that favors body positioning and balance over strength.  Start as far to the left on the boulder as you want, making some moves on jugs into some small crimps and pockets.  The difficulty builds as you move through some shoulder intensive slopers near the "slitty titty," with a final precision stab around the right arete to a good horizontal.  Top out the arete.
content.protection: Pads, probably more than one, since the crux is over a rocky landing.
content.location: Obvious traverse across the front face of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start on a low, juggy, horizontal. Climb through the face using one large hold. Climb through the face using one large hold.
content.protection: A pad or two. Flat landing.
content.location: Directly to the right of the downclimb tree. Obvious slab looking feature with a giant hole in the middle.

content.description: Sit start matched on the big sidepull. Climb up and left past the small roof.
content.location: Around the other side of the boulder with the small roof.

content.description: Same start as the Slitty Titty traverse, but climb straight up on good crimps.
content.protection: pads as it can get kind of high.
content.location: Main face of the Slitty Titty boulder

content.description:
Sit start matched on lowest sloper under obvious

monos. Traverse right under roof and top out on arÃªte.
Stand start matched on jugs just right of the tree. Climb the holdless face.
Stand start matched on a jug 10ft right of the large tree.
Stand start just under the slitty titty feature. Climb straight up through the arete and tall face.
content.protection: Pads, spotter, can get pretty high.
content.location: On the edge of the boulder between Slitty Titty and Walking the Dog.

content.description: Start on Slitty Titty jug and work straight up face using crimps and edges that lead to a harder than expected top out.
